snippet: Will they help advance health care reform by setting up insurance exchanges?
abstract: Editorial analyzes why it is good idea for states to set up health insurance exchanges for their residents as required by health care reform law, rather than letting federal government set them up; contends it is good opportunity for Republican governors and legislators who rail against federal intrusion in activities to show they really mean it.
lead_paragraph: Will they help advance health care reform by setting up insurance exchanges?

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
